TST editor Quick palaeographer Tamil transliteration Sanskrit transliteration
Paratexts
Blessings Colophons Headers Invocations Ownership statements Satellite stanzas Tables of contents Titles TBC
Xylothèque

Blessings

In the TST Project, we define a blessing as a short prose, regularly formulaic phrase, often written in the margins, which is meant to attract auspiciousness, but can also express a credo or reverence to a god or a spiritual master.

BlessingShelfmarkRepositoryTitleUnitPage/folioPlacement
Āmeṉṉ ēcu ௳ Bernolle 1 private Ñāṉanaṭcēttiramālai U2 folio 12v main text area
mariyē reṭciyuM Bernolle 1 private Ñāṉanaṭcēttiramālai U2 folio 12v main text area

śrī Borg.ind.64 Vatican Bhāgavatapurāṇa first folio, recto beginning, marginal, left
harī hari ndan namme bhagavate oṃ ṉṇame bhagavaṉe hari oṃ nnamo bhagavate mahakālāya namaḥ hari oṃ namaḥ - devāñ chitalābhā vande vāñcilattu Cod. Palmbl. III 130 Hamburg Stabi Anaṅgaraṅga guardFolio guard folio
